newsitem.title: UK: IPE Brent closes at new post Gulf War high.
newsitem.headline: IPE Brent closes at new post Gulf War high.

text.p: IPE Brent futures closed at a new post Gulf War high for the near-month contract at $24.45 a barrel after breezing through resistance without a pause in a late rally a few minutes before the close of Monday's session.

November Brent soared to a high of $24.50 a barrel, up 65 cents on the day, as a huge rush to buy swept the IPE floor in the final minutes of trade, largely on the back of stronger NYMEX crude and heating oil futures, brokers said.
It later eased back five cents to close up 60 cents.
Brent overtook the previous post Gulf War high of $24.39 a barrel achieved on Sept 12. The next target for Brent on the monthly charts is the high of $31.20 from January 1991.
A broker said one trader bid the price sharply up just before the close and there was no news to drive the market so high so quickly.
IPE gas oil, which has been supporting the oil complex on supply fears as the winter demand quarter begins, is also trading at its highest levels in more than five years.
